newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares firmer at noon, led by small-caps.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares firmer at noon, led by small-caps.

text.p: Singapore stocks were firmer at noon on Wednesday with much of the activity dominated by small capitalisted issues and electronic stocks.
Dealers said investors were piling into small caps quoted in U.S. dollars because of the recent strength of the American currency.
"The action is still in U.S. dollar stocks. There is some fund interest but a lot of activity is also coming from retail punters," said a dealer with a Singapore firm.
The SES foreign index rose 1.10 pct, or 1.37 points, to 125.91, led by gains in stocks like Lung Kee Metal, up 12 cents to US$1.50, and Wong's Circuits, up 11 cents to US$2.07.
